info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:11PM CDT until May 27 at 6:23AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Little River near Tecumseh affecting Pottawatomie and Seminole Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little River near Tecumseh.
* WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Significant flooding to depths of 5 feet damages croplands... pastures... and rural roads along the river downstream of the U.S. Highway 177 bridge crossing... with lesser damage occurring upstream of U.S. Highway 177. The area affected is entirely rural... and downstream of Lake Thunderbird... from near Macomb in Pottawatomie County to near Bowlegs in western Seminole County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 16.4 feet tomorrow morning and fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
